200.description: return token for user from other services

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: if you use this api must use new token before token expired.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: for get specified user info

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: if not set select all rules otherwise(0,1 for super admin - 2 for agent - 5 for user)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: if not set select all status otherwise(1 active - 2 inactive - 3 removed - 4 banned)

parameters.name: search

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: if not set select all tickets if set(1 pending - 2 for answered - 3 closed)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: 5 for select deactive - 1 for active - 2 for banned - 3 for removed notifications

parameters.name: seen
parameters.description: 1 for select 'seen' 2 for select 'never seen' notifications

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: for get specified ticket info

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: if not set select all tickets if set(1 pending - 2 for answered - 3 closed)

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: login token you can get in login api or put this field in header with this format Authorization: Bearer {token}

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: for get specified notification info

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: 5 for select deactive - 1 for active - 2 for banned - 3 for removed notifications

parameters.name: seen

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: for get specified package info

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: 5 deactive - 1 active - 2 banned - 3 expired - 4 removed

parameters.name: creator
parameters.description: the user id for get user packages

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: some packages has start date for use if you fill this param you get all packages >= this time, time format 'yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss'

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: some packages has end date for use if you fill this param you get all packages <= this time, time format 'yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss'

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: search by package price if you send this param and dont send 'price_op' param system search for all packages with <= this price

parameters.name: price_op
parameters.description: 1 for more than current price '>' | 2 for less than current price '<' | 3 for equal with current price '=' | 4 for more equal '>=' | 5 for less equal '<='

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: 1 or 0 or admin for all admins packages | 2 or agent for get all agents packages | 5 or user for get all users packages | otherwise if you send role param and havnt this values we describ before system return all admin and agents packages

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: for get specified transaction info

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: 5 paid - 1 not paid - 2 pending - 3 removed

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: the user id for get user transactions

parameters.name: package
parameters.description: get specified package transactions

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: get all transactions after this date

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: get all transactions before this date

parameters.name: price
parameters.description: get all transactions less than equal this price

parameters.description: 1 for more than current price '>' | 2 for less than current price '<' | 3 for equal with current price '=' | 4 for more equal '>=' | 5 for less equal '<='
